Good Alternative ending to half life where you play as a soldier, incredible even though im 23 years late.

First off you must know that Half Life: Opposing Force is a standalone DLC for Half Life so play that game first!

Expect the same gameplay as the other Half Life titles with cool interactive puzzles and lively NPCs. Enjoyment of this game will be similar depending on your experience with Half Life. What sets Half Life: Opposing Force apart from the others is the inclusion of a teleportation gun that will send you to the Alien world depending on your position to collect some extra loot which I thought was a clever way to let the player scavenge resources in a pinch if they were in trouble.

Unlike in Half Life and Half Life: Blue Shift where you rely heavily on friendly scientists to achieve your goals, Half Life: Opposing Force felt more like a solo mission where you sometimes meetup with your squadmates purely for some extra firepower. This of course makes sense given the direction of this game to focus more on the action sides of things and did not detract from this path. With the inclusion of many different weapons and additional new types of enemies to kill, Half Life: Opposing Force is worth your time.

You're playing as Corporal Adrian Shephard, which is initially assigned to eliminate Gordon Freeman in the Black Mesa Research Facility. Gamers or Players who have played Half-Life as Gordon Freeman should know the initial expectations for Half-Life: Opposing Force.
Ana oyunda düşmanlarımız olan özel timden Onbaşı Shephard'ı kontrol ettiğimiz hoş bir half life oyunu.

Much better than blue shift.
Around 4 hours to complete the story, far fewer annoying puzzles, more interesting and enjoyable ones. Lots of more interestin and enjoyable combat. New and interesting enviornments and lore. Some new weapons, overall lots of work to make it stand on it's own unlike Blue Shift that basically just reused some HL1 assets and made a two hour escort mission with annoying puzzles and barely any lore.

Overall, good fun, even in 2022 still enjoyable to play. The ending boss/moment was a little... lacking compared to the high it was at just before, but overall still a solid game I'd suggest buying for the five or however many bucks it costs currently (sales happen semi often).

Half-Life was brilliant. It revolutionized the first person shooter, provided hours of entertainment, introduced us to a world of weapons and bizarre creatures, and most importantly- it stayed with its plot throughout the game.Then Opposing Force came along- a mission pack that was a game in and of itself, the player now switching sides and playing through the Military- the enemy in the original Half-Life.Although less plot-driven than the original (its cheif weakness) it still managed to create a very good gaming atmosphere, even if it didn't quite match up with the first.

It's a nice expansion that's easy to breeze through in one day. Play it on medium for a good challenge that doesn't take too much time.

Great expansion pack for a great game. Many people prefer Opposing Force to base Half-Life, and while I disagree I certainly see where they are coming from. Opposing Force does a great job separating itself while also retaining what made the original so great. Half-Life: Opposing Force is a classic and well worth its price all these years later.

PROS:
- Great level design that is more consistent than the original (no Xen)
- Retains most of the base game's weapons while introducing some interesting ones
- Great, if more straightforward storyline, when compared to the original
- Expectedly great performance
- Decent value for an expansion pack, taking ~ 5 hours on a first time playthrough

CONS:
- Some of the newer enemies are not the best
- Has clunky movement like the base game

I wanted to like this one. There's plenty to like about it. But I find that its gaggle of ambitious ideas falls flat in practice. New enemy types are obnoxious bullet sponges in all the moments you want them not to be. The handheld barnacle barely gets any use, due mostly to the fact that it is limited by only being able to latch onto organic matter. It's easy to miss certain new weapons entirely with how out of your way you have to go to find them. The boss fight at the end plays like a Mario or Zelda boss--read into that what you will.

Part of why Half-Life was so revolutionary was that it let a whole story, beat by beat, play out around you as you maintain the in-control first-person perspective. Meanwhile, there's barely any real narrative Corporal Shephard has to call his own outside of G-Man deterring him from escaping to tell the tale and stopping the nuke. What a dated notion, by the way, that G-Man needs to minimize witnesses as though his employers were the US government--clashes a bit with the enigmatic endgame of galactic proportions he clearly attends to from HL2 onwards, don't you think? It's a copout, but I guess the interests of his employers are just always unknowable.

If you want a broader issue that goes more fundamental, though, Opposing Force emphasizes combat over puzzle-solving, and is less forgiving with ammo and recovery. I find that by turning down the brainteasers and room to breathe, the experience loses a lot of what makes it feel like the Half-Life name belongs on it. At a certain point, I got so impatient with the game giving me so much bull all in a row that I turned on godmode and actually enjoyed that experience more. Sorry, Corporal Adrian Shephard, but for all your expansion should have had going for it, it's the Half-Life entry I'm least likely to revisit anytime soon.

Güzel oyun, fiyatı uygun, kısa sürüyor, zevkli ve eğlenceli ama oyun Half-Life serisinin bence en zor oyunu. (Half-Life serisinin Dark Souls'u ) bide zor modda oynayını düşünsenize. Ayrıca alıcaksanız bence indirimde alın ücreti iyi oluyor.

La migliore delle espansioni dell'originale Half-Life, introduce nuove armi, nemici, e meccaniche. Dura il giusto, riuscendo a divertire senza stancare. Poter vivere gli eventi di Half-Life da un'altra prospettiva, rivisitando i luoghi dove è stato Gordon, è un'idea carina. Purtroppo il gunplay rimane invariato rispetto all'esperienza precedente, risultando piuttosto impreciso e molto difficile da padroneggiare, complice il reticolo di mira, piccolissimo e chiaro, si confonde con l'ambiente e non ho trovato opzione per modificarlo. Chi ha apprezzato il gioco base, sicuramente apprezzerà anche Opposing Force.
